item.title: Companies News Today Live Updates on December 29, 2024: Reliance pulls out an old video of a very young Mukesh Ambani from archives for Jamnagar refinery celebrations | Watch | Company Business News - Mint
item.description:
Companies News Today Live Updates on December 29, 2024: Reliance pulls out an old video of a very young Mukesh Ambani from archives for Jamnagar refinery celebrations | Watch

Date: December 29, 2024
Source: LiveMint

Reliance Industries commemorated the 25th anniversary of its Jamnagar refinery by sharing an old video featuring a young Mukesh Ambani, highlighting the company's historical significance in the petroleum industry.

  • Reliance posted an old video of a young Mukesh Ambani to celebrate the Jamnagar refinery's 25th anniversary.
“Stay ahead of the curve with the latest insights from the corporate world,” states the article.

This celebration highlights the continued impact of Reliance's Jamnagar refinery on India's petroleum sector over the past 25 years.

item.title: 'Doesn't seem like suicide': Elon Musk wades into Suchir Balaji death controversy; 'support us', pleads t - The Times of India
item.description:
Doesn't seem like suicide: Elon Musk wades into Suchir Balaji death controversy; 'support us', pleads techie's mother

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: Unknown

The article explores Elon Musk's involvement in the controversial death of tech entrepreneur Suchir Balaji, as well as the emotional plea from Balaji's mother for public support.

  • Elon Musk expresses skepticism about the circumstances surrounding Suchir Balaji's death.
  • Balaji's mother urges the public and media to show support during this difficult time.
  • The controversy raises questions regarding mental health and the pressures faced by tech professionals.
"Support us, we need your voices and help," says Balaji's mother.

The event highlights the increasing pressures in the tech industry and the necessity for mental health awareness and support.

item.title: Suchir Balaji's mother calls for FBI investigation, alleges foul play; flags probe by San Francisco polic - The Times of India
item.description:
Suchir Balaji's Mother Calls for FBI Investigation, Alleges Foul Play

Publication Date: Not provided Source: Not provided

Suchir Balaji's mother is demanding an investigation by the FBI, claiming there has been foul play in her son's case. She has raised concerns regarding the current police investigation by the San Francisco authorities.

  • Demands made for an FBI investigation.
  • Allegations of foul play surrounding the case.
  • Current police investigation is ongoing in San Francisco.
"We need answers and justice for my son. This can't go on without a thorough investigation."

This situation highlights issues pertaining to law enforcement accountability and the need for external investigations in sensitive cases.

item.title: Stocks to Watch on December 30: Reliance Infrastructure, JSW Energy, IOL Chemicals and more - CNBCTV18
item.description:
Stocks to Watch on December 30: Key Movements in Reliance Infrastructure, JSW Energy, IOL Chemicals, and More

Publication Date: December 30, 2024 Source: CNBCTV18

This article highlights several stocks to watch on December 30, 2024, including significant developments in Reliance Infrastructure, JSW Energy, IOL Chemicals, and more.

  • Reliance Infrastructure: The company's unit received notices from Axis Bank and IDFC First Bank regarding alleged defaults on a concession agreement.
  • JSW Energy: Acquired O2 Power for ₹12,468 crore, increasing generation capacity by 23%.
  • IOL Chemicals: Announced a 1-for-5 stock split approved by its board.
  • Axis Max Life Insurance: Plans to discontinue operations of its pension fund management subsidiary.
  • Utkarsh Small Finance Bank: Will sell a portfolio of NPAs and written-off loans worth approximately ₹355 crore.
  • Hero MotoCorp: Extended partnership with Harley-Davidson for new motorcycle development.
“JSW Energy’s acquisition is its largest since inception, consolidating its position in the renewable energy sector.”

The developments in these companies indicate a significant trading day on December 30, with potential impacts on the market and stock performance.

item.description:

Updated Dec 29, 2024 | Source: ET NOW

2024 has proven to be a remarkable year for IPOs in India, with significant entries from major corporations. Looking ahead, 2025 promises a vibrant IPO market featuring high-profile companies like Reliance Jio and LG Electronics.

Key Points:

  • 34 companies approved to launch IPOs raising up to Rs 50,000 crore.

“2025 might be a year where investors might see some holding companies listing their subsidiaries.”

Overall, the anticipation for the IPO landscape in 2025 is high, suggesting a robust array of opportunities for investors.

item.title: Market cap of 6 of top 10 most valuable firms jumps ₹86,848 crore; HDFC Bank, RIL amongst top gainers | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Market Cap of 6 Top Firms Jumps ₹86,848 Crore, With HDFC Bank and RIL Leading Gains

Date: Dec 29, 2023   Source: PTI

Six of the top-10 most valued firms in India added ₹86,847.88 crore in market valuation last week, driven by strong performance from HDFC Bank and Reliance Industries as equity markets showed optimism.

  • Top gainers included HDFC Bank, Reliance Industries, ICICI Bank, Bharti Airtel, ITC, and Hindustan Unilever.
  • HDFC Bank's market capitalisation surged by ₹20,235.95 crore.
  • Reliance Industries added ₹20,230.9 crore, reaching a valuation of ₹16,52,235.07 crore.
  • Other firms like TCS, Infosys, SBI, and LIC saw declines in their market valuations.
Reliance Industries remains the most valued domestic firm, followed by TCS, HDFC Bank, and others.

This trend indicates a vibrant market environment, particularly for some of the leading firms in India, showcasing the fluctuating valuations within the top echelon of corporate giants.

item.title: EV financing no longer risky, says Shriram Finance's executive vice chairman Umesh Revankar | Company Business News - Mint
item.description:
EV Financing Considered Low Risk, Says Shriram Finance Executive

Publication Date: Not provided Source: Mint

Umesh Revankar, executive vice-chairman of Shriram Finance, discusses the current landscape of electric vehicle financing, highlighting its low risk status compared to five years ago.

  • Revankar asserts that established manufacturers are enhancing the reliability of EV technology.
  • He believes that growing infrastructure alongside innovative large entities will drive change in the EV market.
  • The trend of reliable financing is being observed across two-wheeler and three-wheeler segments as well.
"Once large entities come and build technology, reliability and infrastructure, then automatically that industry goes for a big change."

This analysis suggests a positive shift towards financing electric vehicles as market confidence grows.

item.title: Report: ‘Scaling’ Gemini for consumers will be Google’s ‘biggest focus’ in 2025 - 9to5Google
item.description:
Report: ‘Scaling’ Gemini for consumers will be Google’s ‘biggest focus’ in 2025

Date: December 27, 2024   Source: 9to5Google

Just before the holiday break, CEO Sundar Pichai and other Google executives outlined their 2025 strategy, emphasizing that scaling Gemini for consumers is their top priority.

  • Sundar Pichai announced that scaling Gemini on the consumer side will be their primary focus for 2025.
  • Google anticipates the Gemini app to become their next first-party application to reach half a billion monthly users.
  • Pichai highlighted the importance of execution, stating, “In history, you don’t always need to be first but you have to execute well and really be the best in class as a product.”
  • Google aims to 'turbo charge' the Gemini app to evolve products significantly over the next couple of years.
  • Project Astra, related to Gemini, aims to create a universal assistant across all domains and devices.

“Overall, we have some work to do in 2025 to close the gap and establish a leadership position there as well.”

The emphasis on Gemini as a driver for their growth reflects Google's commitment to integrating AI into their core applications.

item.title: The Only SUV You Need Under Rs 10 Lakh! - MotorOctane
item.description:
The Only SUV You Need Under Rs 10 Lakh!

Published on: November 2024 Source: MotorOctane

Skoda India has launched its first compact SUV, the Kylaq, which has quickly gained popularity, surpassing 10,000 bookings within 10 days of its launch. This model offers great features at an attractive price point under Rs 10 Lakh.

  • Skoda Kylaq is based on the Kushaq and is a sub-4 meter compact SUV.
  • It has achieved over 10,000 bookings shortly after launch.
  • Variants include Classic and Signature, with the latter featuring an automatic transmission.
  • Base variants offer LED headlights, 6 airbags, ABS with EBD, among other features.
  • Impressive boot space of 446 liters, dimensions of 3995 mm x 1783 mm x 1619 mm.
  • Powered by a 1.0-litre turbo-petrol engine.
“Overall, it gets impressive features from the base variant, making it a perfect buy for buyers looking for a car in this segment.”

The Skoda Kylaq has made a significant entrance in the compact SUV market, showcasing notable features and a promising performance, making it a strong contender for buyers in this price range.

item.title: Over 2,400 live turtles seized at Trichy International Airport, investigations underway - The Times of India
item.description:
Over 2,400 live turtles seized at Trichy International Airport, investigations underway

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: Times of India

Authorities have conducted a significant bust at Trichy International Airport, seizing over 2,400 live turtles from a shipment. Investigations are currently underway to understand the origins and intended destination of the reptiles.

  • Over 2,400 live turtles were discovered by authorities.
  • The turtles were found during routine checks at Trichy International Airport.
  • Investigations are focused on identifying the individuals involved in this illegal trade.
  • This incident highlights ongoing wildlife trafficking issues in the region.
Authorities reaffirm their commitment to combat wildlife trafficking and protect endangered species.

This seizure demonstrates the ongoing efforts by law enforcement to curb wildlife trafficking and protect vulnerable species from illegal trade.

item.title: In Azerbaijan, South Korea air crashes, survivors in planes’ tail end: what studies say on seating, survival rate - The Indian Express
item.description:
Title: Azerbaijan & South Korea Air Crashes: Rear Seats Show Higher Survival Rate

Date & Source: December 29, 2022, from Indian Express (Source: Link)

Introduction: Two fatal air crashes within a week in Azerbaijan and South Korea have sparked discussions about seating and survival rates. Most survivors were found in the tail end of planes.

  1. On December 25, an Azerbaijan Airlines flight crashed near Aktau, Kazakhstan, with 38 fatalities out of 67 passengers.
  2. On December 29, a Jeju Air plane crashed during an emergency landing in South Korea, with 180 fatalities out of 181 passengers, making it the worst aviation disaster in South Korea's history.
The rear third of aircraft had a 32% fatality rate compared to 39% in the middle and 38% in the front (Time magazine, 2015 study).

Conclusion: While air travel remains statistically safe, studies suggest that the rear of the plane, particularly middle seats, may offer slightly better survival odds in crashes.

item.title: High employee attrition of 25% in private banks pose operational risk: RBI - Business Standard
item.description:
High Employee Attrition Rates in Private Banks Pose Operational Risks, Says RBI

Publication Date: 2023-24 Source: Reserve Bank of India Report

Employee attrition in private sector banks has risen to 25%, creating significant operational risks according to the Reserve Bank of India's latest report.

  • Attrition rates are particularly high in private sector and small finance banks (SFBs).
  • Private banks have exceeded public sector banks in total employee numbers.
  • High turnover can disrupt customer services and lead to loss of institutional knowledge.
  • Strategies recommended for banks include improved onboarding, extensive training, and competitive benefits.
  • Regulators are advised to tighten guidelines on loan practices and monitoring of portfolios.
  • Climate change risks are highlighted as potential threats to financial stability and profitability.
“High attrition and employee turnover rate pose significant operational risks, including disruption in customer services...”

Overall, the RBI emphasizes that addressing employee attrition is a strategic imperative for banks to maintain stability and service quality.

item.title: High employee attrition of 25 per cent in private banks pose operational risk: RBI Report - The Times of India
item.description:
High Employee Attrition of 25% in Private Banks Poses Operational Risk: RBI Report

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: RBI Report

The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has released a report highlighting a concerning 25% attrition rate among employees in private banks, indicating potential operational risks.

  • The employee attrition rate in private banks has reached 25%.
  • This high turnover rate poses significant operational risks to banking institutions.
  • The RBI report calls for banks to address employee retention strategies effectively.
“High attrition rates can disrupt service delivery and affect customer trust in private banks.”

This report signals urgent attention required from private banks to ensure stability and service continuity.

Upcoming IPOs: Indo Farm Equipment among four public offerings to watch out for next week

Date: Not specified | Source: CNBC TV18

Indo Farm Equipment is set to launch its mainboard IPO on December 31, aiming to raise ₹260 crore. The article outlines upcoming IPOs and their details.

"The grey market activity indicates strong investor interest in these IPOs."

item.title: Ahead of New Year 2025, India's largest bank earns Rs 20235 crore in one week, market cap climbs to Rs... - DNA India
item.description:
HDFC Bank Records Rs 20235 Crore Earnings in One Week Ahead of New Year 2025

Publication Date: December 29, 2024 | Source: DNA India

With the New Year 2025 approaching, HDFC Bank, India's largest bank by market capitalization, has achieved significant earnings.

  • The bank earned Rs 20,235.95 crore in just one week from December 23 to December 27.
  • Its market capitalization has surged to Rs 13.74 lakh crore.
  • As of December 27, the share price reached Rs 1,801.
  • HDFC Bank is the third most valued domestic firm after Reliance Industries and TCS.
  • The overall equities market showed a positive trend with six out of the top ten firms gaining Rs 86,847.88 crore in market valuation last week.
“HDFC Bank is the largest bank in India in terms of market cap, while SBI is the largest government bank in the country.”

The growth in HDFC Bank's valuation reflects a broader optimism in the Indian equities market as we enter the New Year.

item.title: Stricter hand baggage rules for Air travel announced. One Bag, Max 7kg - India Today
item.description:
Stricter Hand Baggage Rules for Air Travel Announced: One Bag, Max 7kg

Published On: Dec 29, 2024 | Source: Vaishnavi Parashar

The Bureau of Civil Aviation Security (BCAS) has announced new hand baggage regulations for air travellers, limiting each passenger to one cabin bag weighing up to 7 kg, effective next month. These changes aim to enhance security and streamline airport operations amid rising passenger numbers.

Key Points:

  • One bag limit: Passengers can carry only one handbag or cabin bag weighing no more than 7 kg.
  • Size restrictions: Maximum allowable size for cabin bags is 55 cm x 40 cm x 20 cm.
  • Extra fees for exceeding limits: Excess baggage fees will apply for bags that exceed size or weight limits.
  • Exemptions for pre-purchased tickets: Tickets issued before May 2, 2024, will follow the previous baggage policy.
  • Airlines updating policies: Airlines like IndiGo and Air India are aligning their baggage policies with the new guidelines.

Conclusion:

Travelers are encouraged to review the latest requirements to avoid surprises and ensure a smoother travel experience amid these changes.

item.title: 2025 Personal Finance Updates: Key changes to know and plan ahead; visa, credit card, EPFO, fixed deposits, UPI, more | Mint - Mint
item.description:
2025 Personal Finance Updates: Key changes to know and plan ahead

Publication Date: Not specified   Source: Live Mint

As we approach New Year 2025, it's crucial to realign financial goals by being aware of key changes involving fixed deposits, visa policies, credit cards, and more.

  • Thailand will launch an upgraded e-visa system accessible to broader regions.
  • In the US, new visa policy changes will require Indians to fill out a revised Form I-129 starting January 17, 2025.
  • The UK is raising the financial reserve requirements for visa applicants by 11% from January 2025.
  • New Fixed Deposit rules from the Reserve Bank of India will come into effect, allowing early withdrawals under certain conditions.
  • RuPay credit cardholders will have new criteria for airport lounge access.
  • EPFO will allow pension withdrawals from any bank branch starting January 1, 2025.
  • Unified Payments Interface (UPI) will be enabled for Full-KYC Prepaid Payment Instruments.
"Being unaware of these personal financial changes may lead to missing key deadlines or deprive you of benefits of significant schemes."

In conclusion, staying updated with these changes is essential for effectively managing personal finances in 2025.

item.title: 'Why can't people own the dollars' Deepak Shenoy debates RBI restriction on mutual funds investing in foreign stocks | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Why can’t people own the dollars? Deepak Shenoy debates RBI restriction on mutual funds investing in foreign stocks

Date: December 29, 2024

Source: Live Mint

Deepak Shenoy advocates for an increase in the limit for mutual funds investing in foreign stocks, proposing a raise from the current $8 billion to $50 billion, arguing the existing limit has been unchanged since 2009.

  • Shenoy highlights the disparity between mutual fund limits and individual investment allowances.
  • He questions why Indian mutual funds can't invest more in foreign stocks when individual investors can invest significantly more through foreign brokers.
  • Calls for a reevaluation of the RBI's stance on ownership of foreign assets, suggesting that individuals should have more access to invest through mutual funds.
“Why do we still have restrictions on Indian mutual funds investing in foreign stocks, when we can do the same thing as individuals?” – Deepak Shenoy

item.title: Stocks to BUY for 2025: Up to 80% upside! Adani Enterprises, IndusInd Bank, SBI Life and more - LIST - ET Now
item.description:
Stocks to BUY for 2025: Up to 80% upside!

Updated Dec 29, 2024 from ET NOW

As we approach 2025, investors are eager to find stocks with the potential for significant profits. Bloomberg researchers conducted a poll to identify potential possibilities, focussing on the Nifty Mid Cap 100 and Nifty Small Cap 100 indexes.

Key Points:

  • Adani Enterprises: Expected 80% increase.
  • IndusInd Bank and SBI Life: Target price potentials of 40-50%.
  • Coal India: 43% growth forecast.
  • Oil India: Expected return potential of more than 40%.
  • Sterling and Wilson Solar: Predicted return of over 80%.
“The growth opportunity that our nation provides entices many individuals. We are in the world's largest economy; this is our moment, and we are developing strongly.” - Prateek Agrawal, Executive Director, Motilal Oswal AMC

The article underscores a hopeful market outlook, projecting increases in significant sectors.

item.title: Country's liquor companies may approach FSSAI for separate standard for Indian single malt whisky - The Economic Times
item.description:
Country's liquor companies may approach FSSAI for separate standard for Indian single malt whisky

Date: [Insert Publication Date] Source: [Insert Source]

Homegrown Indian liquor makers are considering approaching the FSSAI for a separate standard for Indian single malt whisky, which has gained popularity and won international awards. This is aimed at maintaining the reputation of Indian single malt exports.

  • Indian distillers want a geographical indication tag for their single malt whisky.
  • Indian single malt whisky sales are rising significantly, facing competition from smaller brands.
  • Current FSSAI definitions inadequately cover single malt standards.
  • Concerns over misrepresentation of Indian single malt by some producers.
  • Growth in the single malt segment attributed to increasing consumer preferences and favorable climate conditions.
“We believe that FSSAI should amend its regulations to include a separate standard applicable to Indian single malt whisky.” — Anant S Iyer, CIABC Director General

The call for a separate standard highlights the need for credibility in the Indian whisky market, which is increasingly competing on a global scale.
